/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.title: redis helm release
/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.name: redis
/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.doc:
Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that is used as a database, cache, and message broker. It provides a fast and flexible solution for storing and retrieving data, making it an ideal choice for a wide range of use cases, including real-time analytics, session management, and more.

Redis is used by Authentik, Authelia, oauth2-proxy.

1:
upstream:
  default:
    - tcp-tls:one.one.one.one
    - tcp-tls:dns.quad9.net
    - tcp-tls:protected.canadianshield.cira.ca
    - https://cloudflare-dns.com/dns-query
    - https://dns.quad9.net/dns-query
    - https://protected.canadianshield.cira.ca/dns-query


upstreamTimeout: 2s

conditional:
  mapping:
    ${SECRET_DOMAIN}: 10.43.131.47:53

bootstrapDns:
  upstream: tcp-tls:one.one.one.one
  ips:
  - 1.1.1.1

redis:
  address: redis.database.svc:6379
  database: 2
  required: true
  connectionAttempts: 10
  connectionCooldown: 3s

blocking:
  blackLists:
    ads:
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/StevenBlack/hosts/master/hosts
      - https://adaway.org/hosts.txt
      - https://v.firebog.net/hosts/lists.php?type=nocross
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/anudeepND/blacklist/master/adservers.txt
      - https://pgl.yoyo.org/adservers/serverlist.php?hostformat=hosts&showintro=0&mimetype=plaintext
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bigdargon/hostsVN/master/hosts
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jdlingyu/ad-wars/master/hosts
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FadeMind/hosts.extras/master/add.2o7Net/hosts
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/crazy-max/WindowsSpyBlocker/master/data/hosts/spy.txt
      - https://www.github.developerdan.com/hosts/lists/ads-and-tracking-extended.txt
    noblock: []

  clientGroupsBlock:
    default:
      - ads
      - noblock
    192.168.1.129/32:
      - noblock
    192.168.1.224/32:
      - noblock
    192.168.1.249/32:
      - noblock
    192.168.10.129/32:
      - noblock
    192.168.10.224/32:
      - noblock
    192.168.10.249/32:
      - noblock
    MBPdeMalisabeth*:
      - noblock
    Marie*:
      - noblock

clientLookup:
  upstream: tcp+udp:192.168.1.1

caching:
  prefetching: true
  minTime: 5m
  maxTime: 5m
  cacheTimeNegative: -1m

prometheus:
  enable: true
  path: /metrics

ports:
  https: 443
  tls: 853
  http: 4000
certFile: /tls/tls.crt
keyFile: /tls/tls.key
logLevel: info
connectIPVersion: v4

/hr/ghcr.io-prometheus-community-charts-.title: snmp-exporter-dell-idrac helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-prometheus-community-charts-.name: snmp-exporter-dell-idrac
/hr/ghcr.io-prometheus-community-charts-.doc:
To monitor Dell iDRAC devices with Prometheus, you can use the SNMP Exporter and use it with the snmp.yml configuration file.

Below you can find other users from our community that have already configured the SNMP Exporter for Dell iDRAC devices. Click on their repository links to see their helm release and in the same directory you should find a config map with the snmp.yml configuration file.

0:
mqtt:
  host: emqx
  topic_prefix: frigate
  user: ${SECRET_FRIGATE_MQTT_USER}
  password: ${SECRET_FRIGATE_MQTT_PASSWORD}
database:
  path: /data/frigate.db
detectors:
  coral:
    type: edgetpu
    device: pci
objects:
  track:
  - person
  - dog
  filters:
    person:
      min_area: 2500
      max_area: 100000
      threshold: 0.7
    dog:
      min_area: 1000
      max_area: 10000
      threshold: 0.7
ffmpeg:
  hwaccel_args:
  - -hwaccel
  - vaapi
  - -hwaccel_device
  - /dev/dri/renderD128
  - -hwaccel_output_format
  - yuv420p
  # Enable audio on recordings...
  # might cause issues on recording playback
  output_args:
    record: -f segment -segment_time 10 -segment_format mp4 -reset_timestamps 1 -strftime 1 -c:v copy -c:a aac
cameras:
  # --
  doorbell:
    ffmpeg:
      inputs:
      # Sub Stream
      # - path: rtsp://admin:${SECRET_DOORBELL_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_DOORBELL_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/102
      #   roles:
      #   - detect
      # Main Stream
      - path: rtsp://admin:${SECRET_DOORBELL_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_DOORBELL_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/101
        roles:
        - rtmp
        - detect
        - record
    detect:
      width: 720
      height: 576
      fps: 15
    record:
      enabled: True
      retain:
        days: 0
        mode: active_objects
      events:
        retain:
          default: 14
        objects:
          - person
          - dog
          - cat
    snapshots:
      enabled: True
      timestamp: False
      retain:
        default: 14
    rtmp:
      enabled: True
    
  front_door:
    # rtmp:
    #   enabled: false
    ffmpeg:
      inputs:
      # Main Stream
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/101
        roles:
        # - rtmp
        # - detect
        - record
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_FRONT_DOOR_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/102
        roles:
        - rtmp
        - detect
        # - record
        # - clips
    detect:
      width: 640
      height: 480
      fps: 15
    record:
      enabled: True
      retain:
        days: 0
        mode: active_objects
      events:
        retain:
          default: 14
        objects:
          - person
          - dog
          - cat
          - car
    snapshots:
      enabled: True
      timestamp: False
      retain:
        default: 14
    # rtmp:
    #   enabled: True

  garage:
    rtmp:
      enabled: false
    ffmpeg:
      inputs:
      # Main Stream
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_GARAGE_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_GARAGE_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/101
        roles:
        # - rtmp
        # - detect
        - record
      - path: rtsp://frig:${SECRET_GARAGE_VIEWER_PASSWORD}@${SECRET_GARAGE_IP_ADDRESS}:554/Streaming/Channels/102
        roles:
        - rtmp
        - detect
        # - record
        # - clips
    detect:
      width: 640
      height: 480
      fps: 30
    record:
      enabled: True
      retain:
        days: 0
        mode: active_objects
      events:
        retain:
          default: 14
        objects:
          - person
          - dog
          - cat
          - car
    snapshots:
      enabled: True
      timestamp: False
      retain:
        default: 14
    # rtmp:
    #   enabled: True

/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-pgad.title: pgadmin helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-pgad.name: pgadmin
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-pgad.doc: pgadmin is a popular administration tool for PostgreSQL. It is a web application that can be run in Kubernetes.

/hr/traefik.github.io-charts-traefik.title: traefik helm release
/hr/traefik.github.io-charts-traefik.name: traefik
/hr/traefik.github.io-charts-traefik.doc: Traefik is a HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer for microservices. It integrates with popular orchestration systems, such as Kubernetes, to provide seamless and automatic service discovery, load balancing, and proxying for your applications. Traefik is designed to be fast, efficient, and easy to use, making it a good solution for home lab environments. With Traefik, you can expose your applications to the internet with ease, providing remote access to your services from anywhere. Whether you're looking to host a personal website, run a web-based service, or simply provide external access to your applications.
